snippet: About 340 refugees were rescued and a search was underway after the vessel, which may have held 700 people, overturned en route to Italy from Egypt.
abstract: At least four migrants die and 340 are rescued after boat headed to Italy capsizes in Mediterranean near island of Crete; incident adds to mounting toll amid deadly period in which more than 1,000 people are thought to have drowned while attempting to cross.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome, Niki Kitsantonis from Athens and Nour Youssef from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: About 340 refugees were rescued and a search was underway after the vessel, which may have held 700 people, overturned en route to Italy from Egypt.

headline.main: Migrant Boat Capsizes off Crete, Killing at Least 4
headline.print_headline: Boat Capsizes Off Crete, Adding to Migrant Toll

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
